{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3100614,"name":"Justus","username":"Jus","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jus/{size}/198009_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-17T18:02:57.896Z","cooked":"

Saw a thread for off-season west coast drives… I wonder what we’re doing with our west coast. 4 Neos can accelerate you pretty quickly. (Below is our first test, the passenger is not me)

Off Season West Coast Drive Technical
Our team decided to do a practice west coast drive in the off-season and I’m looking for feedback on our current design. Included are the native solidworks files, step files, and grabcad link. Some feedback would be appreciated on the gearbox mounting, tube spacer use in the gearbox, and anything else. I’ve also noticed varying thicknesses on bellypan, so we used 3/32" thickness on our sponsor’s waterjet, but are there any good reasons for a thinner or thicker bellypan? Also, I have noticed the …

I want this but swerve and with a wireless controller so you can drive + ride

We have done it with wireless + putting a driver station on a robot really fun to drive yourself.

We also originally tried on an old swerve drive but it wasn’t powerful enough. I don’t know why I wasn’t working on it.

1533 put a lawnchair on a swerve base during an offseason competition after donating their main bot to another team for the event.
It was weighed down to (near) max weight with a Pushing Power Cube™ full of old motors.

image2722×3629 1.85 MB

Glad someone brought this up. This was 4 years ago when both the Raptor and NEOs were both pre-production. One of my fondest memories in high school was driving our coach around our cafeteria to try to break something (other than bones). Good times.

Sacramento News & Review – 20 Nov 07

SN&R • Opinions • The Republic's People of Davis • Chair today, gone...

RoboChair leaves the driving to your recliner.

one of my first memories of FRC was as a freshman in fall 2018 driving around the basement of the school on a chair bolted to a KOP chassis. one time someone accidentally turned off the laptop that we were using to run the code for it and i started spinning around in circles until i managed to find the breaker and turn it off. good times.
